channel.title: Hosting
channel.description:
I have a problem with hosting my server on No-Ip, the main problem is no-one can join, I used to host on no-ip but after a 2 week holiday i came home and it stopped letting people join...
PATH: [IMG]http://i381.photobucket.com/albums/oo256/jake_tyrrell/PATH.jpg[/img]
CLASSPATH: [IMG]http://i381.photobucket.com/albums/oo256/jake_tyrrell/CLASSPATH.jpg[/img]
No-IP(I tried with the ip unchecked): [IMG]http://i381.photobucket.com/albums/oo256/jake_tyrrell/No-Ip-1.jpg[/img]
UTorrent: [IMG]http://i381.photobucket.com/albums/oo256/jake_tyrrell/Utorrent-1.jpg[/img]
Portforwarding?: [IMG]http://i381.photobucket.com/albums/oo256/jake_tyrrell/PortForwarding-1.jpg[/img]
So thats what i have done, I have also added the port into my firewalls Exeptions...
Please help.

item.title: Hosting
item.dc:creator: @cloudscape cloudscape
item.description:
@cloudscape wrote:

[quote=“bonzakid, post:8, topic:264720”]Maybe your ip has changed??
Consider on checking it through
command prompt / ipconfig
and see if its still;
192.168.1.1
It may of changed.[/quote]

it’s still 192.168.1.1…

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“rofllewisrofl, post:2, topic:264720”]It’s not that complicated.

Just simply sign up at www.no-ip.com[/quote]

I’m glad you noticed the picture with his no-ip application operating.

On Topic:

I have had this same problem, The host expired but did not notify me on the no-ip application; Check your account on the website to check the status of your host.

Read full topic
